statement.tex: \text{A manufacturer produces nuts and bolts. It takes 1 hour of}\\ \text{work on machine A and 3 hours on machine B to produce a}\\ \text{package of nuts. It takes 3 hours on machine A and 1 hour on}\\ \text{machine B to produce a package of bolts. He earns a profit of}\\ \text{Rs 17.50 per package on nuts and Rs 7.00 per package on }\\ \text{bolts. How many packages of each should be produced each day}\\ \text{so as to maximise his profit, if he operates his machines for at}\\ \text{the most 12 hours a day.}

step.reason: \text{Since we need to maximise the total profit from sales}\\ \text{what we require is simply the product of number of}\\ \text{packages of each kind, with the per unit profit of each}\\ \text{package}.

step.context: \text{Given the conditions, what would the constraints}\\ \text{on x and y, the number of each type of package, be?}
step.tex: \text{Machine A time constraint,}\\ \begin{align} \qquad &x(pkgs)\cdot 1(hr/pkg)+ y(pkgs)\cdot 3(hrs/pkg) \le 12 \\ \implies &x+3y \le 12 \end{align}\\ \text{Machine B time constraint,}\\ \begin{align} \qquad &x(pkgs)\cdot 3(hrs/pkg)+ y(pkgs)\cdot 1(hr/pkg) \le 12 \\ \implies &3x+y\le 12 \end{align}\\ \text{Number of packages cannot be negative}\\ \qquad x\ge 0\, y\ge 0

step.reason: \text{To calculate the time for which the machines are being}\\ \text{run, multiply the number of packages of each kind}\\ \text{being produced with the hours for which each machine}\\ \text{is being occupied. As per the condition, the total hours}\\ \text{should be LESS than the max 12 hour a day specified.}
\text{As per the constraints, the feasible region,}\\ \text{is bounded by the x and y axes and the area}\\ \text{below lines }x+3y=12 \text{ and } 3x+y=12
